data.title: You missed it...CLOSED!!!!
data.text: THis wonderful restaurant closed for good earlier this year. I enjoyed eating with Nick and Iris for over forty years. I wish them much joy in retirement but I truly miss them. 2016.

data.title: Great family run restaurant
data.text: have been in downtown Greenville for ever. Very good food, friendly service. good family or with friends

data.title: Never disaapointed
data.text: The food and service are always excellent and authentic.  I am never dissappointed when I visit this restaurant.  I just cannot get enough of it.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Enjoyed a wonderful dinner with friends the other night. Service was a little slow but no one was in a hurry. Had pita  ( 8 small wedges) and hummus, tasty but at 8.95 a little overpriced. Also shared the dolmades and spanakopita, also very good but do not recall the price. Limited drink choices and did not see the prices (our fault). Homemade wine was sweet! And the dry red was adequate. We did not try any other beverage.  The lamb was excellent, fork tender and very well flavored with a mild tomato sauce. One person had a chicken gyros and loved it. The boys loved the moussaka and definitely got the clean plate club. Shared the baklava and a custard dessert, good but would probably pass next time as always conscious of extra calories.  Atmosphere "homey"  and eclectic. Would go back but not in any rush.

data.title: Highly recommended
data.text: Wonderful homemade Greek food, that is consistently good every.time we go and very affordable. Only two blocks from Main Street in downtown Greenville and well worth the walk.

data.title: Nice place but atmoshpere and food quality is lacking.
data.text: Decided to try this place after passing it many times in the city.  Saw some mixed local reviews but that didn't stop us.  We were anxious to get some good home cooked Greek Style food.  We entered the restaurant which looks like a single family home.  The elderly lady told us to sit anywhere in the room, which looked like the original living room.  There was other seating to the right in another room of the house. So, you get the drift, we are sitting in a house, waiting on an elderly couple to make some food for us.  Our waiter was a younger generation female who was very attentive. In the back I saw an elderly gentleman moving food in and out of what looked like a microwave, but it could have been an oven.  I am not sure.  the door swung out like a microwave, and unfortunately, the food tasted like it had all been prepared and frozen.  Just not very good.  The bread on the table was stale.   Clearly this couple has been cooking for a long time, and they are friendly and certainly of Greek origin, as evidenced by all the memorabilia in the place.  It just seems that it might be time to upgrade the quality of the food.

data.title: Sloppy
data.text: When we read the reviews about this place it sounded great. My boyfriend and I had grown tired of eating at the same places around greenvilled and were excited to try something new. So we decided to try it. We ordered the sampler. However, when the food came out I was disgusted. I have plenty of greek food and I could tell just by looking at it was not going to be good. The food was slopped together on the platter. It was over seasoned and gross tasting. It looked like a TV dinner. My boyfriend was horribly disappointed too and I was disappointed for him because he had never had Greek food before. I was really excited to have him take a step out of his comfort zone of buffalo zinger wraps and try something new. Unfortunately, I don't think we will be having Greek again.

data.title: Great news...restaurant continuing
data.text:
I have always feared that I would stop by Never on Sunday and Nick and Iris would have posted a sign saying, "Closed-retired to Florida" That is NOT going to happen! Iris has passed the recipes to her niece and the two Irises are working together to keep the wonderful traditions and great Greek food that we have come to love at Never on Sunday. 

I suspect that Nick and Iris will remain active in the restaurant for some time. It is a very special place and their customers love them!

data.title: Great Greek Food, Wonderful Family Atmosphere
data.text: Nine of us  extended family members including a 20 month old had an enjoyable family dinner and setae grateful that the food was delicious, the service comfortable, and the guests around us enjoyed our little one who ate wonderfully.  The staff accommodated him and us adults graciously.  The comment about "Americanized" food walker this year is odd...I am grateful for Greek food...and glad that the Greek community really does understand "Americanized" by giving us the best burgers and dogs around for 80+ ears and some of the best steak houses anywhere! The Greek style beef and potatoes were great for those with less experimental tastes!

data.title: Pass
data.text: Don't go - Greenvill has so much more to offer.  I had chosen this placed based on the other reviews for authentic Greek food at a fun mom& pop kind of place. Well, Nick & Iris are not there anymore.  The food is watered-down Americanized over-cooked yuck. I was completely disappointed.  The lemon/chicken/orzo soup had good flavor, but orzo overcooked and no chicken.  Spinach pie - soggy pastry, no cheese. Dolmades - leaves too tough, covered in a yellow sauce that had no flavor and stuffing was very bland. "Greek" potatoes - overcooked potatoes (really, cooked just one minute away from becoming mashed potatoes) in that horrid red sauce. The only flavor is salt.  GREEK potatoes should be roasted with lemon and rosemary!!

data.title: Favorite restaurant in SC
data.text: Great food...try the Combination Plate...in traditional Greek fashion. Husband/wife restaurant team are wonderful. Nick cooks and takes the money; Iris does everything else. I have eaten there since 1970s and love each visit.

data.title: Best food in Greenvile!
data.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Greenville SC... real Greek food made fresh! I drive 70 miles to eat here.

data.title: I love nick and iris
data.text: I have been going to never on sunday for over 25 yrs with my family. I live on the other side of the state now and i still find time when i'm in greenville to go. The food is wonderful and i love the quaint atmosphere.

data.title: Smells like death
data.text: I knew by the smell of the place I should have left. I did not like my food because it was just like a t.v. dinner...it was gross. When I would not eat it, with or with out sauce, the cook said there was something wrong with me. My friend did not like her food either she said it was too salty and HURT her stomach. Do not eat here, it is a waste of money, and gives Greek food a bad name.

data.title: Tradition still exists - say Hi to Iris and Nick
data.text: Never on Sunday is a Greenville institution; Iris and Nick have personal and family photo's all over the restaurant to prove they have been here since 1968....but time is passing and they are talking of retiring.  We returned once again to have a great traditional Greek meal...so many choices and always tasty and full of flavor.  Iris with her smile and warm greetings to everyone who enters, and Nick in the kitchen insuring high quality food full of traditional Greek favors.  Hurry up, they will be retiring, so visit now while tradition continues....their family may carry on the tradition, but will it be as good?  Ah, the challenges of a family restaurant that has served the Upstate so many years with personality and food full of traditional and flavor.  Recommend you go soon, support an Upstate tradition and buy one of their new T-Shirts designed by one of the grandchildren....or will that be a new owner in 2012?

data.title: Better than Athen's
data.text: my wife and I have frequented this restaurant for over 30 years. Nick and Iris are very special people and serve what I would call home style Greek dishes on a consistent basis. We have never had a bad meal here. I have traveled Greece and experienced the old world flavor,  believe me...the only thing missing is the sea. I might just caution folks on Iris's sense of humor....its like Dicks Last Resort meets Greek.....lol....really kidding, she is very funny, to the point  and you will love her! Trust your taste buds...dolmades are great, the combo plate is great and the wine is excellent. If you partake here and you say your meal is not to par....your digestive system needs repair!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Not your typical Greek American restaurant. The food was excellent and I had a hard time deciding to keep some for leftovers as I really really wanted to finish my plate. Friendly people too.

data.title: a plce tha makes you feel at home
data.text:
if you want very good greek food. nick&iris good people, and are the sme each time .
if you are not looking for real greek food then dont go,if you are you will not be disapointed

data.title: One of a kind
data.text: Came upon this place by accident at bout 1pm.. Has parking available, a real asset in the downtown area. This Mom and Pop has been there for 43 years and probably has not changed much. I would expect the bulk of their business is local. Iris is the server and she is a pip! menu is limited and you should be hungry. Not the best Greek food I have had but is certianly authentic. My rating is generous but you will get burned stopping by here if you like Greek food.

data.title: Simply The Best
data.text:
I've eaten with Nick and Iris at every opportunity since I was a college student at Clemson University in the late 1960s. Although I live 200 miles away, I never miss the chance to visit if I'm anywhere near Greenville. I've dined all over the world, East and West, and the dolmades and the family wine here are still my favorite meal! My only fear is that Nick & Iris may retire, be sure to visit before they do.
Miller S. Ingram, Jr.
